p: Comparing the findings of de Souza et al. [ 25] with our results, the molluscicidal effect of QE aqueous extract on A. vulgaris adults does not stand out from the effect of B. pillosa aqueous extract on Subulina octona ( Table 3). However, in both cases the plants were different and one case involved a slug of 70–150 mm in length, while S. octona is a much smaller snail with a 10–20 mm shell. The LC 50 on A. vulgaris was 68.5 g/L, quite similar to the LC 50 (≈51.4 g/L) on S. octona [ 25]. In both experiments, molluscs were exposed by dermal contact.
